appendix.title: Example Network Configuration for &cloud;
appendix.para: The following example shows a network setup where &cloud; is set up as a private cloud within an organization. The companies internal network comprising services and workstations is named &exampledomain; and uses the 10.10/16 address range.

The &cloud; is deployed in a separate network named cloud.&exampledomain; and using the 10.11.20/22 address range. &cloud; is always located in a single physical network and creates an additional three virtual networks (vLAN):

listitem.para: 10.11.20/24: Administration/BMC network to access the nodes (physical)
10.11.22/24: Public network to access the Nova Dashboard and &vmguest;s with floating IP addresses (vLAN)
10.11.21/24: Fixed network to access the &vmguest;s with default IP (vLAN) addresses
10.11.23/24: Internal network for block (ceph) and object (swift) storage (vLAN)

appendix.para: The administration network can be reached via a gateway with the address 10.11.24.1 while the vLANS can be reached via 10.11.22.1.
